CatDescriptText: Mr. S.R. Wallace, laborer, 6368 Shakespeare Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 9, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that we are spending too much money for foreign aid? Do you think that what we have spent has halted the spread of communism?" answer reads: "I positively think that we are spending too much for foreign aid.  I believe that charity begins at home and then spreads abroad.  Here, in this country, we have many needy people whom we should help, and I might add that during our depression in '30s, none of the foreign countries offered to help us."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of S. R. Wallace wearing moustache and dark hat with large brim, standing in front of building with Raab Clothes sign in background, Wood Street, Downtown
